title: Cover, "Credit Card Reliquary", 1991
markings: Marks: Signed on underside of (a): "Nolen 1991" in black script.
creditline: Museum purchase from Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Fund
description: (a) large ovoid vase, resting on twisted rope base. Sides of vase modeled with rope and husk garlands, surrounding four reserve panels: each reservewith depiction of major credit card--Mastercard ; American Express / Visa /Diner's Club International. Each credit card is shown against a spiral cloud-like ground. Ground between reserves is modeled and painted with blue and flesh fronds against a puzzle-like ground of green fragments (money?). Rope and husk garlands surrounding reserves linked with four balls: " MEMBER SINCE 60 / VALID FROM 02/78 / GOOD THRU 02/91 /SIGN HERE X." The shoulders of the vase curve into a flared neck, supported by three-dimensional percentage symbols. The neck is painted with four rope- framed reserves against a blue ground, each painted with "19.8" The domed cover is painted with a green fragment of money and with gold coins with "$" in centers. A modelled and applied ribbon at each side is inscribed: "CREDIT EST MORT." The finial is in the form of a man in a business suit, holding in his right hand an attache case, his head bowed and covered by his left hand, and wearing outspread feathered wings.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cover, "Credit Card Reliquary", 1991.
1991. porcelain, overglaze enamels. Museum purchase from Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Fund. 1992-1-2-a,b.
